00017 ## \brief Framework for Monte Carlo simulations
00018 #
00019 class MonteCarloFramework(frameworkBase.FrameworkBase, forkscript.ForkScript):
00020   ## \brief
00021   def __init__(self, userModel, nrSamples=0):
00022     frameworkBase.FrameworkBase.__init__(self)
00023     forkscript.ForkScript.__init__(self)
00024 
00025     self._d_model = userModel
00026     self._testRequirements()
00027 
00028     # adding framework specific attributes and methods
00029 
00030     # keep this fttb
00031     self._addMethodToClass(self._readmapNew)
00032     self._addMethodToClass(self._reportNew)
00033 
00034     assert type(nrSamples) == types.IntType
00035     try:
00036       self._setSampleNumbers(1, nrSamples)
00037     except Exception, msg:
00038       sys.stderr.write('Error: %s\n' % str(msg))
00039       sys.exit(1)
00040 
00041     # Consecutive model runs by default
00042     self._d_forkSamples = False
00043 
00044     self._initialiseSampleDirectories()
00045 
00046   ## \brief Sets the forking of samples on or off.
00047   #
00048   # \param fork True or False.
00049   #
00050   # When forking is on EVERY sample will be forked to its own
00051   # process. This is mainly useful on a cluster with automatic
00052   # process migration or on SMP machines.
00053   #
00054   # \warning setrandomseed does not work when forking is enabled
00055   # \warning not available on Windows
00056   def setForkSamples(self, fork, nrCPUs=1):
00057     if (sys.platform == "win32"):
00058       self.showWarning("Forking not available on Windows platforms")
00059       self._d_nrProcessors = 1
00060       self._d_forkSamples = False
00061     else:
00062       # default detect nrCPUs
00063       if(nrCPUs == 1):
00064         self._d_nrProcessors = system.nrCPUs()
00065       else:
00066         self._d_nrProcessors = nrCPUs
00067       self._d_forkSamples = fork
00068 
00069   ## \brief Returns whether samples should be forked.
00070   def _forkSamples(self):
00071     return self._d_forkSamples
00072 
00073 
00074   ## \brief Returns the class provided by the user
00075   def _userModel(self):
00076     return self._d_model._userModel()
00077 
00078   ## \brief Returns the framework provided by the user
00079   def _userFramework(self):
00080     return self._d_model
00081 
00082   def _testRequirements(self):
00083     if (not isinstance(self._userFramework(), staticFramework.StaticFramework)) and (not isinstance(self._userFramework(), dynamicFramework.DynamicFramework)):
00084       msg = "Cannot run MonteCarlo framework: User model must be type of \
00085 StaticFramework or DynamicFramework"
00086       raise frameworkBase.FrameworkError(msg)
00087 
00088     if not hasattr(self._userModel(), "premcloop"):
00089       self.showWarning("No premcloop section defined.")
00090 
00091     if not hasattr(self._userModel(), "postmcloop"):
00092       self.showWarning("No postmcloop section defined.")
00093 
00094 
00095   ## \brief Re-implemented from ShellScript.
00096   #
00097   # Runs the user model in the Monte Carlo mode.
00098   def run(self, premc=True, postmc=True):
00099     self._atStartOfScript()
00100     self._check()
00101 
00102     if premc:
00103       self._runPremcloop()
00104 
00105     # Samples.
00106     sample = self._userModel()._firstSampleNumber()
00107     while sample <= self._userModel()._lastSampleNumber():
00108 
00109       if self._forkSamples():
00110         assert self.isParentProcess()
00111         while self._systemIsOccupied(self.nrChildProcesses()):
00112           if self._debug():
00113             self.showMessage("System is occupied")
00114           # Wait for some seconds.
00115           # But first handle finished children.
00116           for childProcess in self.handleFinishedChildProcesses():
00117             if not self._quiet():
00118               if self._debug():
00119                 self.showMessage(childProcess.message())
00120           time.sleep(0.1)
00121 
00122         # Throw in another sample.
00123         if self._debug():
00124           self.showMessage("Starting sample %d" % (sample))
00125         self.fork(str(sample))
00126 
00127         if self.isParentProcess():
00128           # Stop parent process to enable child process to start and
00129           # the load to adjust.
00130           # But first handle finished children.
00131           for childProcess in self.handleFinishedChildProcesses():
00132             if not self._quiet():
00133               if self._debug():
00134                 self.showMessage(childProcess.message())
00135           time.sleep(0.01)
00136 
00137       # Child processes start here.
00138       if not self._forkSamples() or \
00139          (self._forkSamples() and self.isChildProcess()):
00140         self._incrementIndentLevel()
00141         self._atStartOfSample(sample)
00142         self._userModel()._setCurrentSample(sample)
00143         # Execute model
00144         self._d_model.run()
00145 
00146         self._sampleFinished()
00147         self._decrementIndentLevel()
00148 
00149       # Child processes stop here.
00150       if self._forkSamples():
00151         if self.isChildProcess():
00152           os._exit(0)
00153 
00154       assert not self._forkSamples() or self.isParentProcess()
00155       sample += 1
00156 
00157     if self._forkSamples() and  self.isParentProcess():
00158       for childProcess in self.waitForChildProcessesToFinish():
00159         if not self._quiet():
00160           if self._debug():
00161             self.showMessage(childProcess.message())
00162       assert not self.childProcesses()
00163 
00164     if postmc:
00165       self._runPostmcloop()
00166 
00167     return 0
00168 
00169 
00170 
00171   ## \brief Creates the directories in which the sample data can be stored.
00172   #
00173   # \attention Already existing sample directories will be cleaned!
00174   def _initialiseSampleDirectories(self):
00175     sample = self._userModel()._firstSampleNumber()
00176     while sample <= self._userModel()._lastSampleNumber():
00177       dirname = "%d" % (sample)
00178 
00179       if not os.path.exists(dirname):
00180         # Create sample directory.
00181         os.mkdir(dirname)
00182       else :
00183         if not os.path.isdir(dirname):
00184           # Remove existing file with name of sample directory.
00185           os.remove(dirname)
00186           os.mkdir(dirname)
00187         else:
00188           # remove existing and create emtpy directories
00189           shutil.rmtree(dirname)
00190           os.mkdir(dirname)
00191 
00192       assert os.path.exists(dirname) and os.path.isdir(dirname)
00193       sample += 1
00194 
00195 
00196   ## \brief Used for the genetic algorithm
00197   def _setNrSamples(self, nrSamples):
00198     """Sets the number of samples to run."""
00199     assert nrSamples > 0
00200     self._setSampleNumbers(self._firstSampleNumber(),
00201          self._firstSampleNumber() + nrSamples - 1)
00202 
00203 
00204   def _setSampleNumbers(self, firstSampleNumber, lastSampleNumber):
00205     assert firstSampleNumber > 0
00206     if lastSampleNumber <= 0:
00207       msg = "number of samples argument (%s) of MonteCarloFramework must be > 0" % (lastSampleNumber)
00208       raise AttributeError(msg)
00209     assert lastSampleNumber >= firstSampleNumber
00210 
00211     self._userModel()._d_firstSampleNumber = firstSampleNumber
00212     self._userModel()._d_lastSampleNumber = lastSampleNumber
00213 
00214   ## \brief Returns true if new processes can be forked
00215   def _systemIsOccupied(self, nrChilds):
00216     return nrChilds >= self._d_nrProcessors
00217 
00218 
00219 
00220 
00221 
00222   ## Checks the current configuration of the script.
00223   def _check(self):
00224     if self._userModel().nrSamples() == 0:
00225       self.showWarning("""
00226    Since the number of samples to execute is 0, only the premcloop
00227    and the postmcloop functions will be executed. Any script that does
00228    something meaningful needs to calculate at least one "sample".""")
